snippet: Yemen’s president proposed a national unity administration and suggested reinstating fuel subsidies, government officials said, in moves aimed at quelling weeks of unrest.
abstract: Yemeni Pres Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi, in effort to quell unrest, proposes a national unity administration and suggests reinstating fuel subsidies; Shiite Muslim group Houthis rejects Hadi's proposal, raising concerns that instability in Yemen will worsen.
lead_paragraph: Yemen’s president proposed a national unity administration and suggested reinstating fuel subsidies, government officials said, in moves aimed at quelling weeks of unrest.

headline.main: Yemeni President Dismisses Government After Weeks of Unrest
headline.print_headline: Yemeni Leader Dismisses Government Amid Unrest

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
